\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/choicedesign.design:choicedesign.design.RUMDesign}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{choicedesign.design.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{RUMDesign}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{atts\_list}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{list}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{n\_alts}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{int}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{ncs}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{int}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{optout}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{bool}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{asc}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}dict\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
RUM\sphinxhyphen{}consistent discrete choice experiment design class

\sphinxAtStartPar
This class allows to create an efficient design for a discrete choice
experiment based in a Random Utility Maximisation (RUM) model {[}1{]}.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{atts\_list}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dict}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}) \textendash{} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
List of attributes of the design. Each element is a dictionary that
contains the following keys:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{name}: the attribute name

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{levels}: a list of attribute levels

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{coding}: the coding of the attribute levels. Supporte types are
‘numeric’ and ‘dummy’.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxtitleref{pars}: prior parameters of the attribute. If \sphinxtitleref{coding = ‘numeric’
then only one parameter is required. If \textasciigrave{}coding = ‘dummy’, then
\textasciigrave{}levels\sphinxhyphen{}1} parameters must be used. The first attribute level is
taken as a baseline.

\end{itemize}


\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{n\_alts}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Number of alternatives, apart from the opt\sphinxhyphen{}out (if defined).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{self.ncs}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Number of choice situations.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{optout}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Should an opt\sphinxhyphen{}out be included? If so, it is included as the last alternative,
by default False.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{asc}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dict}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Dictionary that defines alternative\sphinxhyphen{}specific constants (ASC) and their respective
prior parameters. Each key is the alternative in which an ASC is desired, and
each value is the corresponding prior parameter.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}
\index{optimise() (choicedesign.design.RUMDesign method)@\spxentry{optimise()}\spxextra{choicedesign.design.RUMDesign method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{generated/choicedesign.design:choicedesign.design.RUMDesign.optimise}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{optimise}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{cond}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}list\DUrole{p}{{[}}str\DUrole{p}{{]}}\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{n\_blocks}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}int\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{iter\_lim}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}int\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{noimprov\_lim}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}int\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{time\_lim}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}int\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{seed}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{Optional\DUrole{p}{{[}}int\DUrole{p}{{]}}}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{None}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{verbose}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{bool}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{default_value}{False}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Create D\sphinxhyphen{}efficient RUM design

\sphinxAtStartPar
Starts the optimisation of the design using a random swapping
algorithm and the attributes and prior parameters specified in
the \sphinxtitleref{RUMDesign} object. Allows for conditions, blocking and
user\sphinxhyphen{}defined stopping criteria.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{cond}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{[}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{{]}}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} List of conditions that the final design must hold. Each element
is a string that contains a single condition. Conditions
can be of the form of binary relations (e.g., \sphinxtitleref{X \textgreater{} Y} where \sphinxtitleref{X}
and \sphinxtitleref{Y} are attributes of a specific alternative) or conditional
relations (e.g., \sphinxtitleref{if X \textgreater{} a then Y \textless{} b} where \sphinxtitleref{a} and \sphinxtitleref{b} are values).
Users can specify multiple conditions when the operator \sphinxtitleref{if} is defined,
separated by the operator \sphinxtitleref{\&}, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{n\_blocks}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Number of blocks of the final design. Must be a multiple of the number of
choice situations, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{iter\_lim}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Number of iterations before the algorithm stops, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{noimprov\_lim}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Number of iterations without improvement before the algorithm
stops, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{time\_lim}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Time (in minutes) before the algorithm stops, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{seed}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Random seed, by default None

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{verbose}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{bool}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} Whether status messages and progress are shown, by default False

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{optimal\_design} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{pandas.DataFrame}) \textendash{} The final (optimal) design

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{init\_perf} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{float}) \textendash{} D\sphinxhyphen{}error of the initial design

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{final\_perf} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{float}) \textendash{} D\sphinxhyphen{}error of the final design

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{final\_iter} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{int}) \textendash{} Total number of iterations

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{ubalance\_ratio} (\sphinxstyleemphasis{float}) \textendash{} Utility balance ratio

\end{itemize}


\end{description}\end{quote}
